import PIL.Image

# these sys calls aren't actually necesarry in Kaggle notebooks, but you may need to add the data directory to your pythonpath to run the sample API off of Kaggle
import sys
sys.path.append('../input/tensorflow-great-barrier-reef')   

import greatbarrierreef
env = greatbarrierreef.make_env()   # initialize the environment
iter_test = env.iter_test()    # an iterator which loops over the test set and sample submission
source.41aa935e:
for (pixel_array, sample_prediction_df) in iter_test:  # iterate through all test set images
    sample_prediction_df['annotations'] = '0.5 123 456 10 10'  # make your predictions here
    env.predict(sample_prediction_df)   # register your predictions
source.7171d08a: We have to register a prediction before we can get the next image.
source.ae5a3b71: The sample prediction dataframe includes a valid default prediction that you will want to overwrite.
source.3de2ca18: The API will return one image per call as pixel array, and the relevant row from the sample prediction dataframe
